revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Achievements and Awards in 1981
tldr: The President's address at the Royal Society's Anniversary Meeting highlights the scientific achievements and awards presented in 1981. Notable recipients include Dr. P. D. Mitchell for his chemiosmotic hypothesis, Sir Geoffrey Wilkinson for his work in organometallic chemistry, Dr. Marthe L. Vogt for her contributions to synaptic biochemistry, Dr. R. Riley for his work on wheat genetics, Professor R. A. Raphael for his organic synthesis contributions, and the Hughes Medal awarded to Professor P. W. Higgs and Professor T. W. B. Kibble for their work on spontaneous symmetry breaking in particle physics. The address also mentions Sir Stanley Hooker's contributions to aero engine design and the development of various commercial engines.
